meanings.definition: A person or thing that loads.
meanings.sent1: The loaders at the warehouse efficiently load boxes onto trucks.
meanings.sent2: The loaders in the construction site help move heavy materials.
meanings.sent3: The loaders in the game were tiny robots that loaded virtual cargo.
meanings.sent4: The loaders in the movie were portrayed as superheroes who loaded supplies for the team.
meanings.sent5: The loaders in the story had magical powers to load items with just a touch.

meanings.definition: A device or mechanism used for loading.
meanings.sent1: The loaders on the ship lifted containers effortlessly.
meanings.sent2: The loaders in the factory efficiently move products along the assembly line.
meanings.sent3: The loaders in the toy store were miniature conveyor belts.
meanings.sent4: The loaders in the kitchen were like tiny cranes lifting ingredients.
meanings.sent5: The loaders in the game were mechanical arms that loaded items into the virtual world.

meanings.definition: A type of software used to load data or programs into a computer's memory.
meanings.sent1: The loaders on the computer quickly loaded the new software.
meanings.sent2: The loaders for the game ensured smooth loading of levels.
meanings.sent3: The loaders in the program were depicted as little digital helpers.
meanings.sent4: The loaders in the system worked silently to load files in the background.
meanings.sent5: The loaders on the screen displayed loading progress for the user.
